data.title: Pluggable and PluggableNode.
data.body:
Added a trait pair Pluggable and PluggableNode that allow nodes to be placed on a specified cell of an existing structure.

I have no example to ship this with unfortunately as we'd want to have the option to remove actors that already exist in the cell but this was shot down on this trait pair so something else will need to be worked out.

data.title: Remove husks from radar
Ingame map editor : Smart tile drawing
data.body:
It would be really useful if the new ingame map editor could analyze the direction of cursor when the player is drawing with tiles.

With this "path", OpenRA could maybe apply correct tiles, in order to create nice looking cliffs.

Currently, here is what we can do:
![screenshot002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2562007/121faf7e-b835-11e3-99f5-a273600335a4.png)

OpenRA would record the mouse gesture, record which category of tile is currently used (here : cliffs):
![screenshot003](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2562009/5b5dce14-b835-11e3-8e3e-825d8aac7efd.png)

And with these informations, it could redraw the player's tiles with correct ones:
![screenshot004](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2562010/5e5d15ca-b835-11e3-9fd4-0744f8f48c84.png)

data.title: Add a big (96px) grass temperate tile to help cleaning a map in progress with lots of tiles everywhere
data.body:
Could it be possible to add a new temperate (grass) terrain tile, which is the size of Tile ID 2 (the 48px water tile). So a 96px grass temperate tile.. 

This could be usefull to fix the mess after painting tiles everywhere..

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1450690-add-a-big-96px-grass-temperate-tile-to-help-cleaning-a-map-in-progress-with-lots-of-tiles-everywhere?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add a tutorial minigame map
data.body:
A tutorial minigame map that explains each aspect of the game step by step would be great. There could even be a dedicated main menu button that said "Take the tutorial".
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1450493-add-a-tutorial-minigame-map?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Implement an in-game manual
data.body: It would be great if there was an in-game manual that described every unit and building in detail, with their health points and their attack points against each type of unit. Maybe even some game tactics and strategy could be explained. This would be accessible during the game. Every hot key and their functions would be listed.

data.title: Husks appear as enemy units on radar map
data.body: Husks of enemy tanks appear in that player's color on the radar.

data.title: Allied satellite: pixelarts of destroyed buildings should disappear from fog of war like icons do
data.body: If I have satellite vision, I can see enemy buildings as icons on the fog of war. And when one of those buildings gets destroyed, or is sold, its icon disappears. (I haven't tested sold buildings disappearing.) If I see/spot a building on the map, its pixelart stays on the fog of war. But if this building gets destroyed, its pixelart doesn't disappear like icons do. So seeing a building results in a loss of information. This doesn't make sense. Therefore if a player has satellite vision then pixelart of destroyed enemy buildings should also disappear from the fog of war. This should also work for buildings that were destroyed before the satellite launch.

data.title: Production tab doesn't accept clicks near the right edge
data.body:
If an element in the production tab is clicked near the right edge of the tab, approximately right of the red line in the image below, the click is not registered and it does nothing.

![production](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/2559358/55fcea4e-b778-11e3-9f6e-bd9406c2fb3a.png)

data.title: Scroll velocity polish
data.body: Unrelated stuff from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496 I stumpled over including a fix added for https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3462.

data.title: Added GetSprite to ShpImageWidget
data.body: prerequisite for https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/commit/a1630705f13a48f652eae971b993d3874f879db2

data.title: Tileset YAML improvements
data.body: standalone additions from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4496.

data.title: Mouse cursor seems to move faster while in windowed mode
data.body: I don't know if it's just me but the mouse cursor in the game moves noticeably faster and it is harder to control in windowed mode than in full screen mode.

data.title: Add a separate button to hide/show production window
data.body:
When the button of an active tab is clicked, the whole production window slides off and becomes hidden. This is annoying if it is accidentally clicked and you have to move the cursor to the new position of the tab button. I think there should be a separate hide/show button for this purpose and the tab buttons shouldn't hide the window. Here is a crude mock up of how it could look like:

![hide_tabs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/2559155/51698722-b76d-11e3-85c5-1d9bdcd26b2a.png)

This has the advantage that the hide/show button doesn't change positions but this could also lead to mis-clicks while trying to click the top right element in the production tab. Maybe this function could be removed entirely?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1450324-add-a-separate-button-to-hide-show-production-window?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Debug menu has different names
data.body: In lobby options it is called "Debug Menu", on the in-game menu button it is called "Cheats" and the actual menu window has the title "Developer Mode". I think it should have the same name for consistency.

data.title: Menu windows overlap
data.body:
Options menu and cheats menu always overlap because they are both centered. Options/cheats menu and diplomacy/statistics menu overlap in low resolution such as in windowed mode. And cheats menu button and game timer overlap in low resolution.

![snapshot16](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6599106/2558865/e9ece30e-b75e-11e3-8da1-4da24164d084.png)

data.title: Add diplomacy change option to Tiberian Dawn
data.body: I realized that there is no option for diplomacy changes in Tiberian Dawn as there is in Red Alert.

data.title: Disable edge scrolling while options menu is open
data.body: In Red Alert mod, edge scrolling still works when options menu is opened. I think it would be better if it was disabled while options is open. Options menu should halt the game. This is the behavior in Tiberian Dawn mod.

data.title: Lock mouse cursor inside openra window while in windowed mode
data.body:
When in windowed mode, mouse cursor can move out of the window. This is annoying if edge scrolling is used. I think it would be better if the cursor was locked inside the window, and released only with a special key combination like alt+tab. When the mouse is released, it shouldn't control the game, no mouse input in released state. And when the user clicks inside the window, openra regains control of the mouse and locks it in again.

There could also be an option in settings menu to change this behavior.

This link was provided in #openra channel:
http://gamedev.stackexchange.com/questions/33519/trap-mouse-in-sdl

data.title: Make health bars 2 pixels shorter
data.body:
Currently health bars are the same size than its building (48 px).
It makes health bars look weird if buildings are placed side by side:

![screenshot001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2558261/4dcd3aa8-b73d-11e3-9bfc-4edabb4c96fe.png)

I think 2 pixels should be removed (-1 pixel on each side of the health bar) to make it look like this:

![screenshot002](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2558277/0964312c-b73e-11e3-85cc-e3eac50bb374.png)

So 46px health bars for buildings like Power Plants...
and 22px health bars for silos..

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1450277-make-health-bars-2-pixels-shorter?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

It imports original spawn slots now correctly

data.title: Tweak the DEBIAN copyright file
data.body: Adhere to http://www.debian.org/doc/packaging-manuals/copyright-format/1.0/

data.title: Added LineBuildNode trait to filter which structure(s) a LineBuild actor can be attached to.
data.body:
D2k walls now attach to turrets.
This has been requested and serves as an example for this trait pair.

In this example the Sandbag `SBAG` will LineBuild onto itself and the `SOMEDEF` actor definition.
You can see how this can be used for very generic or specific cases.

``` yaml
SBAG:
    LineBuild:
        NodeTypes: sbag, chicken
    LineBuildNode:
        Types: sbag

SOMEDEF:
    LineBuildNode:
        Types: chicken
```

Don't forget to include the `Range: <int>` property on the LineBuild trait!

data.title: Artillery and V2 should move away from a target that is too close
data.body: If an artillery or V2 is ordered to attack an enemy unit that is closer than their minimum range, they do nothing and stay where they are. It would be better if they automatically moved away from the target until it is in range and then started firing at it.

data.title: Add reverse gear to vehicles
data.body:
Instead of only being able to move in one direction, vehicles could also move in the reverse direction with a decreased speed. This would also make it possible for units that have to face their targets, to shoot while retreating, like artillery and V2 for example. And wheeled vehicles would not turn on the spot like tracked vehicles, but they would reverse and maneuver like cars do.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1448627-add-reverse-gear-to-vehicles?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>
